descriptionHTML:
The first flashlight app for the Android Wear operation system. Use your wearable as flashlight. It is simple and easy to use, a great helper for on the go. Download now for free. To start the app. Just say: OK Google...Start flashlight.


Get more top apps, games & news with "Android Wear Center": http://tinyurl.com/m87stxs


You have to own an Android Wear device to use this app
Currently compatible devices:
► HUAWEI Watch
► Moto 360 Gen 2 (2015)
► Moto 360 Gen 1 (2014)
► Asus Zenwatch
► LG G Watch
► LG G Watch R
► LG G Watch Urbane (Android Wear version)
► Samsung Gear Live
► Sony SmartWatch 3


Please note:
-Make sure your mobile is compatible with Android Wear.
-Make sure to pair your phone with the wearable device with help of the Android Wear App.
-To open: Go to "Start..." and open the app "Flashlight" or say "Start flashlight"
comments: Simple but Works Does all you would need with a flashlight. There are two color choices both adjustable that alternate with a touch of the screen. A slide to the right and it's off. Adjustments are made by swiping left. Simple.
I downloaded it and i couldnt find the app to open it
Perfect for preventing screen burn in ðŸ¤“

Really cool...and useful! The first time I installed it, it didn't seem to work. I re-synced the apps through Android Wear and it came up. That's the only fault.. and it was mine. This is such a great and simple app which will come in handy often. Thankyou!

Works as described Initially the "OK Google, start flashlight" launched the flashlight app on my phone. Ah, a conflict I thought. Then realised the Android wear version hasn't finished downloading and installing. After waiting, the phrase actually launched the wear app instead. Brilliantly simple. On screen toggle button would be good.
